event: Earliest human presence in present-day Luxembourg
Celtic tribes inhabit the Ardennes and Moselle regions
Roman rule integrates the region into Gallia Belgica
Roman authority collapses during the Migration Period
Fortress of Luxembourg is founded, forming the basis of the state
Luxembourg is elevated to a duchy within the Holy Roman Empire
Burgundian forces seize control of Luxembourg
Habsburg rule begins under the Spanish Netherlands
Austrian Habsburgs gain control after the War of Spanish Succession
France annexes Luxembourg during the Revolutionary Wars
Congress of Vienna creates the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg
Luxembourg is partitioned, establishing modern borders
Treaty of London guarantees Luxembourgâ€™s neutrality
Germany occupies Luxembourg during World War I
Nazi Germany occupies Luxembourg in World War II
Luxembourg abandons neutrality and joins Western alliances
Luxembourg becomes a founding member of the European Economic Community
